resources.string: Select the time to end video playback:

"Many dogs are left at home alone for at least up to 8 – 10 hours a day. Many pay for one-on-one professional training sessions or come home and work on basic commands to train your dog. SeeMeTrain training app allows you to train your pet while you are at work or out of the home for an extended period of time during the day.

Procedure: 
• Set the schedule and playlist information
• Place the device in an area that the dog can hear and see the video, but not reach.
• Keep the commands simple. Repeat the commands. Give the dog praise (minus the treats).
• When making your video, make it as natural sounding as possible. Allow for a few minutes to let the dog complete the command since you can’t see him/her do it.
• Come home and test it out!

Developed by Team Sapphire in Capstone Program from College of Computer Science and Engineering in Ohio State University
Team members: Joe Donnelly, Ramya Ravishankar, Soumyashree Gad and Zijiang Yang
Professor: Alan Cline
Icons made by FlatIcon.com, FreePik.com and http://www.iconsmind.com"

Tips:

Record yourself giving simple, clear commands to your dog.
Give only one command per video.
Start with an easy command like sit, stay or lie down.
Videos are limited to 60 seconds.
